question.text: Draw the C Major scale in treble clef using two measures of quarter notes in 4/4 time.
question.hint: The C Major scale consists of the following notes of C - D - E - F - G - A - B. The C note begins on the first ledger line below the staff in treble clef.

question.text: Draw the G Major scale in bass clef using two measures of quarter notes in 4/4 time.
question.hint: The G major scale consists of the following notes of G - A - B - C - D - E - F#. The G note begins on the second line from the bottom of the staff in bass clef. There is a sharp on F (on the second line from the top) in bass clef.

question.text: Draw the F Major scale in treble clef using two measures of quarter notes in 4/4 time.
question.hint: The F Major scale consists of the following notes of F - G - A - Bb - C - D - E. The F note begins above the first line from the bottom of the staff in treble clef. There is a flat on B (on the third line from the top) in treble clef.

question.text: Draw the Bb Major scale in bass clef using two measures of quarter notes in 4/4 time.
question.hint: The Bb Major scale consists of the following notes of Bb - C - D - Eb - F - G - A. The Bb note begins on the second line from the bottom of the staff in bass clef. There are flats on B (on the second line from the bottom) and on E (below the second line from the top) in bass clef.

question.text: Draw a low Ab, a mid Bb, and a high Eb in C major. Use a treble clef in any time.
question.hint: A flat is drawn with a vertical line followed by a curved line whose endpoints touch the vertical line's middle and bottom point. This accidental lowers its corresponding note by a half step. Like all accidentals, it is added to the left of the note.

question.text: Draw a low G#, a high C#, and a high F# in C major. Use a treble clef in any time.
question.hint: A sharp is drawn with two horizontal lines intersecting two vertical lines. This accidental raises its corresponding note by a half step. Like all accidentals, it is added to the left of the note.

question.text: Draw a low A, a mid B, and a high E in Eb major. Use a treble clef in any time.
question.hint: A natural is drawn with two right angles whose horizontal ends touches the middle of the vertical lines. This accidental cancels previous accidentals. Like all accidentals, it is added to the left of the note.
